content:
the Michigan Daily

One hundred and thirtythree years of editorial freedom





A female University of Michigan student reported a thirddegree sexual assault Wednesday to the Division of Public Safety and Security PERIOD The student told police she was grabbed by an unknown male and sexually assaulted on March  according to a crime alert sent out to students Friday afternoon PERIOD

The suspect is described as a  to 20yearold white male approximately  feet  inches tall and weighing  to  pounds with a thin build and short dark hair PERIOD He pulled the female into a custodial closet in South Quad Residence Hall at approximately  p.m PERIOD and sexually assaulted her PERIOD

According to the report he was wearing a loose fitting shirt and pajamas pants or sweatpants when he carried out the attack PERIOD

According to the Sexual Assault Prevention and Awareness Center thirddegree sexual assault constitutes penetration and can include force or coercion and victim incapacity PERIOD

Melissa Overton University deputy chief of police said the alert was sent out once the survivor filed a report and DPSS subsequently assessed the threat level to students PERIOD

Different people react differently to trauma and so once she did bring it forward we had to do a little bit of further investigation before we determined that there was a possible public safety threat and so thats when we determined to issue the crime alert Overton said PERIOD

Overton also said DPSS is still investigating and will be working closely with SAPAC to connect the survivor with resources she might need PERIOD

This is a developing story PERIOD Check back at michigandaily.com for more details PERIOD

title: Third-degree sexual assault reported in South Quad Residence Hall
